cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles WSW of Marco Island, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the central Gulf Coast (MS/AL coast)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast near the Mississippi-Alabama border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Mouth of Pearl River to AL-FL border; Storm Surge Watch: west of Shell Beach LA to Mississippi River mouth & east of AL-MS border to Navarre FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning: Shell Beach LA to AL-MS border; Tropical Storm Warning: Golden Beach FL to Bonita Beach FL, Florida Keys/Florida Bay, and Gulf Coast from Okaloosa-Walton County line FL westward to east of Morgan City LA (incl. Lake Pontchartrain/Lake Maurepas)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central Gulf Coast (FL Panhandle, AL, MS, southeast LA)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with a very small (â‰¤4%) chance of sustained 34-kt winds; strongest flow remains well offshore in the Gulf.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the northeast Florida coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only scattered outer-band showers; heavy rainfall threat confined to South Florida and, later, the central Gulf Coast.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated that would significantly disrupt port operations.
